We are an agile, passionate team capable of building scalable, performant solutions to solve real world problems on a global scale. As a member of the Client Onboarding team, you will work with our sales teams and back office review teams to write and update client onboarding applications using modern technologies. The successful candidate will need to work in a team environment, help influence the direction of our technology and be able to interact with other team members and teams on creating exciting solutions to complex problems. You will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact – the work you do will help in tangible way

Follow our software development practices and methodologies
Participate in scrum ceremonies, including Story Pointing, Sprint Planning, Sprint Reviews and Sprint Retrospectives

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
Overview:
StoneX Digital Payments is looking for an Engineering Manager to lead the design, development, and implementation of software for the platform. This focuses on developer experience, operational excellence, automation, and quality. You will hire and manage a team of full stack platform engineers whose goal will be to deliver high-quality software that aligns and speeds up the software engineering teams. Reporting to the Head of Engineering you will be a key leader in executing our technology strategy and taking the lead on lean agile projects, ensuring projects are completed up to quality standards and on time.
You will be responsible for the technical excellence and approach taken by team members, including providing guidance and oversight, planning and monitoring work schedules, managing capacity, analyzing software performance and configuration systems, ensuring peer code reviews and documentation, and managing the deployment and integration of new software in alignment with technology standards. You will collaborate with Core IT and software engineering teams to plan, scope, develop and deploy solutions, continuously iterating to ensure that new features are adding value, enabling, and empowering our software engineering teams.

Qualifications:

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
Position Purpose: The Machine Learning Engineer is responsible for empowering the Data team to achieve its value-add objectives: setting up data pipelines for Data ingestion, Analytics, Machine Learning on large data sets to derive value from firm’s data assets. The ideal candidate will exhibit passion for continuous improvement and a dedicated focus on enabling consumers to achieve their goals by making data driven decisions.
Number of Openings: 2
Location: 230 South LaSalle, Ste. 10-500, Chicago, Illinois, 60604
Primary Accountabilities/Responsibilities:
Develop software solutions and implement machine learning algorithms and tools to drive data science and machine learning projects.

Overview:
The Full-Stack Developer is a member of the product development team who takes responsibility for implementing parts of the system architecture using best practices in an agile development environment. This will include coding, unit testing, using design patterns, learning new technologies, and becoming an expert in the system. The candidate will also be expected to provide technical leadership, architectural support, and overall solution design support.

Overview:
We are seeking a UI/UX Designer to join our product design team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing experiences for browser-based financial software and custom mobile apps for our end users.
Responsibilities:
Create pixel-perfect screen mock-ups and prototypes of complex financial software in Figma
Take a positive hands-on approach to collaboration on product innovation and standardization

Title: Software Developer II
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Sr. Robotic Process Automation Developer is responsible for the development, operation, and maintenance of RPA applications and business process workflows, primarily built on 3rd party applications. The developer ensures that system hardware, operating systems, application configuration, and related procedures adhere to company policies and standards.

The developer will assist in the design, implementation, and support of new process workflows in collaboration with other staff, including Solutions Architects, Business Analysts, and Project Managers. The developer will collaborate with Network, Server, Database Administration, and other development teams to ensure the proper integration of systems in the environment.
Responsibilities:

Design, configure, and implement RPA process flows, content management and workflow application solutions

Job_Description:

The technical Lead managing development team and supporting Financials: General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, Assets, Cash Management.
Lead the development team for in-house and cloud integration applications.

Defining new and refining existing solutions using industry best practices for enterprise data management and data integration.

You will be a member of the product development team who takes responsibility for implementing parts of the system architecture using best practices in an agile development environment. The successful candidate will be a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity, detail oriented with an eye for good design, thrives in a lean agile team, and is interested in making an impact in self-directed trading applications similar to Webull, Interactive Brokers, and Robinhood.

Title: Product Designer - UX & UI
Job_Description:
Overview:
StoneX Digital Payments is looking for a talented and experienced Product Designer, UX & UI to join our team and help build our client facing UIs. You will be an early member of the Product team with significant expertise and exposure to Payment Portals and Client Journeys, which will be critical for StoneX to build competitive advantages. You are always thinking about the client pain points as you deliver the features. In this role, you will be working closely with Product Managers, Software Engineers, Architects and key stakeholders from Product, Operations, Client Services and Sales to deliver optimal value for our clients. Our approach is both customer-focused and data-informed, so you are required to have relevant experience in the Payments industry.
Responsibilities:
Build from scratch the end-to-end Product design and UX of the Client Portal
Help build the public API, Hosted Checkout page and additional UI components
Qualifications:

Title: Product Manager - Data & Analytics
Job_Description:
Overview:
StoneX Digital Payments is looking for a talented and experienced Product Manager, Data & Analytics to join our team. You will be an early member of the Product team with the highest level of technical expertise in leveraging data to build competitive advantages for StoneX. You are always thinking about the customer journey and security as you build a data driven product. You are required to have technical experience with financial systems and challenges from the Payments industry. You will be ultimately responsible for managing the entire lifecycle of a global product from planning to launch. You will be guiding the development of our platform to deliver optimal value for our clients.
You will be responsible for roadmap prioritization, product lifecycle development, and the continuing success for multiple domains. In this role, you will be working closely with key stakeholders mainly from Technology, Product, Operations, Client Services and Sales.
Our approach is both customer-focused and data-informed, so you will be required to have relevant experience and a deep technical understanding of key components from back-office processes for clearing, settlement, funding and cash conversion. Being familiar with the Payment processing ecosystem such authorization, capture, refund, void, API integrations is also critical.

Qualifications:

Title: Product Manager - Data & Analytics
Job_Description:
Overview:
Company Profile

StoneX (formerly known as INTL FCStone) is an institutional-grade financial services network that connects companies, organisations and investors to the global markets ecosystem through a unique blend of digital platforms, end-to-end clearing and execution services, high-touch service and deep expertise.

We provide access to 36 derivatives exchanges, 175 foreign exchange markets, nearly every global securities marketplace and a number of bi-lateral liquidity venues. We deliver this access with support throughout the entire lifecycle of a trade – from consulting and “boots-on-the-ground” intelligence, to best execution, to post-trade clearing, custody and settlement. In these ways, StoneX enables clients to use the global markets ecosystem to achieve their business goals through one trusted partner.

StoneX (formerly known as INTL FCStone) is an institutional-grade financial services network that connects companies, organisations and investors to the global markets ecosystem through a unique blend of digital platforms, end-to-end clearing and execution services, high-touch service and deep expertise.

We provide access to 36 derivatives exchanges, 175 foreign exchange markets, nearly every global securities marketplace and a number of bi-lateral liquidity venues. We deliver this access with support throughout the entire lifecycle of a trade – from consulting and “boots-on-the-ground” intelligence, to best execution, to post-trade clearing, custody and settlement. In these ways, StoneX enables clients to use the global markets ecosystem to achieve their business goals through one trusted partner.

StoneX currently serves more than 30,000 commercial, institutional and payments clients, and more than 125,000 retail clients across more than 130 countries. Our clients use our institutional-grade digital platforms, our high-touch service, and our market intelligence to pursue trading opportunities, make investments efficiently, manage their market risks, and improve their business performance. Our relentless focus on helping them accomplish these objectives has enabled us to build deeply valued, long-term relationships based on guidance, integrity, transparency and trust.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Full Stack
Job_Description:
Overview:
Company Profile

StoneX (formerly known as INTL FCStone) is an institutional-grade financial services network that connects companies, organisations and investors to the global markets ecosystem through a unique blend of digital platforms, end-to-end clearing and execution services, high-touch service and deep expertise.

We provide access to 36 derivatives exchanges, 175 foreign exchange markets, nearly every global securities marketplace and a number of bi-lateral liquidity venues. We deliver this access with support throughout the entire lifecycle of a trade – from consulting and “boots-on-the-ground” intelligence, to best execution, to post-trade clearing, custody and settlement. In these ways, StoneX enables clients to use the global markets ecosystem to achieve their business goals through one trusted partner.

Job_Description:

As part of the AML Group’s Transaction Monitoring function, in this role the individual will be responsible for conducting a variety of tasks such as BAU Alert reviews, investigations, preparing narrative information for SAR filings, conducting enhanced due diligence, and participating in ad hoc projects as needed. They will utilize internal and external investigative resources and apply logical research techniques.

Title: Incident Analyst
Job_Description:
Overview:
An exciting opportunity to join a growing physical trading firm and help build a next generation commodity trading and finance business. Our business approaches commodity trading differently: enabling producers and consumers with better data, insights, and tools; all through a unique platform and value proposition. We are a physical commodities trader operating across the globe and across a wide range of commodities and currencies – from Crude Oil to Coffee to Corn to Cocoa – but are approaching the industry in a different way: focused on delivering value for clients through a best-in-class platform (People, Processes and Technology).

The position will be a key member of the StoneX Commodity Solutions LLC Portfolio Management Team (the “SCS PM Team”). The SCS PM Team is responsible for the onboarding and underwriting of all customers of the business as well as proactively monitoring and mitigating credit risks across the customer portfolio on an ongoing basis – with a focus on counterparty-level risk as well as broader industry and portfolio-wide risks. The position exposes the Portfolio Manager to various underlying commodity markets and transaction structures – from commodity merchandising and logistics to risk management and inventory financing solutions. The position is integral to the business and offers high visibility, responsibility, and an opportunity for growth for the right candidate.
